intro: Blepharoglossum trichechum, commonly known as the Brazilian velvet fern, is a unique epiphytic plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Selaginellaceae and is characterized by its dense, moss-like appearance with tiny, overlapping leaves. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on tree trunks or rocks. Its structure resembles a carpet of foliage, which helps it retain moisture in its natural habitat. Despite its delicate appearance, it is resilient and can survive in low-light conditions.
